forecast.name: This Afternoon
forecast.detailedForecast: Rain after 4pm. Partly sunny. High near 55, with temperatures falling to around 53 in the afternoon. South wind 2 to 6 mph. Chance of precipitation is 90%. New rainfall amounts between a tenth and quarter of an inch possible.

forecast.name: Tonight
forecast.detailedForecast: Rain. Cloudy. Low around 50, with temperatures rising to around 56 overnight. South southeast wind 1 to 25 mph, with gusts as high as 48 mph. Chance of precipitation is 100%. New rainfall amounts between 1 and 2 inches possible.

weather_report:
A haze of gray blankets Downtown San Francisco, as thick clouds loom above like blankets pulled tight against a restless sky. As the afternoon progresses, the air, which feels damp and cool against the skin, carries the promise of rain that will drench the city come late afternoon. The temperature hovers near 55, but an unmistakable chill hints at more than just a mere drop in degrees. With the winds softly murmuring from the south, even the most weathered local knows that it's best to prepare for the impending downpour. 

As the evening unfolds, the skies will weep steadily, with rain accumulating to a significant amount, cloaking the streets in a slick sheen. Under such dimmed skies, the clarity of day is a gentle illusion, with everything wrapped in shades of muted expectation. The best attire calls for waterproof jackets and perhaps sturdy footwear, as puddles will likely accompany each step outside. While the vibrant life of the city slows in rhythm, the weather invites one to explore cozy enclaves—perhaps indulging in a warm cup of coffee at a local café or taking a leisurely stroll through an art gallery, letting the world fade into the background while the rain serenades the city into night.
